title: Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers's Grand Champion garden
text:
Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers's Grand Champion garden JO MCCARROLL Last updated 05:00, September 26 2015 Larnie Nicolson Larnie Nicolson Larnie Nicolson Larnie Nicolson Larnie Nicolson 
The most commented on feature in Bob and Val Ford's colourful garden is the perfect lawn. Bob's secret is adding one tablespoon of sulphate of iron and three tablespoons of sulphate of ammonia to a watering can of warm water and applying it every week for four weeks before the event. He also mows three times a week "so weeds don't get a look in". The Fords won Best Front Garden and Grand Champion in the Chronicle Garden Competition. 
Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers Grand Champion garden winners Bob and Val Ford. The couple have been part of the festival for more than two decades and taken out the Best Front Garden prize many times before but this year, for the first time, they took out the top prize. 
Chronicle Garden Compeition judge Ross McKinnon called the Fords' garden "a crescendo of colour". 
Wisteria in bloom over an arbour. Bob joked this arbour was the most photographed thing in Toowoomba over carnival week. 
Conifers and camellias in Bob and Val Ford's Toowoomba garden. 1 of 5 « Previous « Previous Next » Next » 
Bob and Val Ford took out the Grand Champion award at the Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers and were named Best Front Garden with their mix of annuals, bulbs and perennials, native and exotic shrubs and a (truly extraordinarily) perfect lawn.
